title: How to Avoid Financial Disaster: 6 Best Books
text:
Author Doug Shadel says the typical victim of a financial scam is a wealthy man over 55 who does well on a financial literacy test. Read this book to find out why you're so vulnerable. 
If you spend a lot of time reading personal finance articles: 
This books from author Helaine Olen will make you a smarter -- and more skeptical -- consumer of personal finance journalism. If you have time to read only one book: Weapons of Fraud , AARP, 2005Authors Anthony Pratkanis and Doug Shadel got their hands on 645 undercover audiotapes of swindlers pitching people on the telephone and analyzed how cons persuade their victims. The book includes transcripts of many of those phone calls, and is an eye-opener for any consumer who thinks they'd never fall for a smooth talker. 1
